This app fetches and displays conversion rates for a list of some currencies from the given API in every 1 second.

 When the user taps on a currency, it is moved to the top of the list, the rate field is focused. If the user changes the input, all the other currencies will update with the actual rates.

 When there is no internet connection, the app will provide offline conversions based on the latest cached base-rate data.

 These rates are saved locally and are updated whenever internet connectivity is restored.

 When there is no internet connection, at app start a Snackbar informs the user about the offline usage if there is data in the local cache.

 The project uses the Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) architecture with the Single Activity design and Navigation Component.

 Libraries used:
 - Material design for respecting the latest UI trends in Android development
 - Koin for dependency injection
 - Timber for logging
 - Retrofit for networking
 - Moshi for JSON parsing
 - Couroutines for asynchronous operations
 - Room for storing the rates locally (offline cache)
